availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born in 1808 in Culpeper County Virginia. Graduated from William and Mary College. Married in 1841 to Maria Emerson. Children included Maria, R.W. Walker, John M., Hettie, Edward Thomas, Pinkie, and Mary. Worked as an attorney in Jimtown, Kentucky from 1841 until he moved to Clinton in 1855. Moved to Columbus in 1857. Served as circuit judge of the First Judicial District and member of Kentucky. Died in 1883 in Columbus, Kentucky.

bibl.p: William Elsey Connelley, History of Kentucky, Volume 5, 35 (Lousiville: American Historical Society, 1922).
